Title: Apache Kafka
Subtitle: An open-source distributed event streaming platform

Articles.Title: Event
Articles.Subtitle: Record / Message
Articles.Content: Event (Record or Message) is just a thing that have happened with a description

Articles.Title: Topic
Articles.Subtitle: Logical Composition
Articles.Content: A logical composition of Partition having a logical name for producing and consuming records (Events) or a fundamental unit for organizing events​
Multiple non-overlapping subsets of records with-in a topic (partitioning) to store records across machines. A Topic partition is totally ordered sequence of records​
Articles.Title: Partition
Articles.Subtitle: Sequence of Events

Articles.Content: Copies (replicates) of partition records across multiple nodes. Every partition has one leader and N-1 follower to provide fault-tolerance​
Articles.Title: Replication
Articles.Subtitle: Copies / Replicates

Articles.Content: A computer instance or a container running Apache Kafka process to manage partitions, replication of these partitions​
Articles.Title: Broker
Articles.Subtitle: Computer Instance

Articles.Title: Producer
Articles.Content: Client application responsible for appending records to the log file of a Topic partition. Actual I/O is performed by the broker on behalf of producer client​
Articles.Subtitle: Writer Client Application
Client Applications that are Read from Topic Partition​
Articles.Title: Con​sumer

Articles.Content: A monotonically increasing number that serves as a unique identifier for a record in a partition. A consumer internally maintains an offset that points to the next record​
Articles.Title: Offset
Articles.Subtitle: Unique Identifier

Articles.Content: Lag for a topic partition is expressed as number of offsets that are behind the head of partition.​
Articles.Title: Lag
Articles.Subtitle: #Events to be Consumed

Articles.Content: A topic partition is an append-only ledger that may only be mutated by the Producer or Kafka itself. Consumer should commit its offsets frequently to avoid duplication​
Articles.Title: Commit
Articles.Subtitle: Consumed Event Identifier

Articles.Content: Topic partitions are assigned to balance the assignments among all consumers in the logical group. All consumers work in a balanced mode​
Articles.Title: Consumer Group​
Articles.Subtitle: Logical Group

Articles.Content: The optimal number of consumers should be equal or less then number of partitions to avoid any idle consumer​
Articles.Title: Idle Consumer​
Articles.Subtitle: #Consumers Across Group

Articles.Content: Consumers across groups are isolated and has their individual partition assignments and offsets​
Articles.Title: Isolated Consumers​
Articles.Subtitle: #Consumers Across Group
Infrastructure Code should be Written by Community​
Articles.Title: Eco-System

Articles.Content: Think of a stream as an unbounded continues real-time flow of records. The most common use cases of streams are filtering, joining, grouping, and aggregation​
Articles.Title: Kafka Streams
Articles.Subtitle: Unbounded Continues Records

Articles.Content: Kafka connect is a framework for connecting non-Kafka systems to Kafka in a declarative way, without requiring you to write a bunch of non-differentiated integration code​
Articles.Title: Kafka Connect
Articles.Subtitle: Connecting Non-Kafka Systems
Shortcoming that may cause Developer Frustrations​
Articles.Title: Gotchas

Articles.Content: The number of configuration parameters in Kafka can be overwhelming, not only for new commers but also seasoned pro​
Articles.Title: Tunable Knobs​
Articles.Subtitle: #Configuration Parameters

Articles.Content: Kafka defaults tends to be optimized for the performance, and will need to be explicitly overridden on the client when safety is a critical objective​
Articles.Title: Unsafe Defaults​
Articles.Subtitle: Optimized for Performance

Articles.Content: Kafka is capable of delivering messages over network as alarmingly fast rate, which can eventually cause a DoS attack if we are using an unchecked Kafka Consumer​
Articles.Title: Back-Pressure​
Articles.Subtitle: Alarmingly Fast Rate

Articles.Content: Using older client with newer topic message formats, and vice versa, places extra load on the broker. This should be avoided whenever possible​
Articles.Title: Format Conversion​
Articles.Subtitle: Extra Load on the Broker
